text: Mark Blum (May 14, 1950 – March 25, 2020) was an American actor. He was born in Newark, New Jersey. He co-starred in Sweet Surrender in 1987. He also appeared on the following programs; Capital News in 1990, Frasier in 1997, and NYPD Blue in 1999. From 2014 to 2018, he appeared in Mozart in the Jungle. He won an Obie Award for his performance as Al in the Playwrights Horizons production of Albert Innaurato's play, Gus and Al, during the 1988–1989 season.1988–89 Obie Awards . InformationPlease.com; retrieved March 23, 2016. In 2018, Blum was cast in a recurring role as Ivan Mooney in the former Lifetime thriller series You. Blum died at a hospital in New York City on March 25, 2020, from COVID-19 at the age of 69. ==References== Category:1950 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American movie actors Category:American stage actors Category:American television actors Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in New York City Category:Actors from Newark, New Jersey
title: Mark Blum
